summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 3, 2019, discussing operational planning for the imminent arrest of Jeffrey Epstein. It details a two-wave deployment of agents to Florida to serve subpoenas to co-conspirators and interview victims, while explicitly keeping the investigation separate from the 2008 Miami case.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the planned arrest operation discussed in the email. The FBI is planning to deploy agents to Florida when his arrest is effected.

events.title: FBI Planning for Epstein Arrest
events.description: FBI agents in New York discuss operational plans for a two-wave deployment to Florida following the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein. The first wave involves serving subpoenas to co-conspirators, and the second involves interviewing victims.

events.title: Prior Miami Investigation
events.description: Referenced as a prior investigation from 2008 that the SDNY wants to keep the current operation separate from, indicating a desire to avoid using agents from the Miami field office.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein in July 2019, indicating the operation was imminent.
The plan involved a two-phase deployment of FBI agents to Florida: first to serve subpoenas to co-conspirators, then to conduct 'knock and talk' interviews with victims.
The Southern District of New York (SDNY) explicitly instructed that no agents from the Miami field office be used, to keep this investigation separate from the 2008 Miami case involving Epstein.
The communication shows high-level coordination within the FBI to manage the logistics (travel, funding) of a major arrest and investigation operation.
